title: Mayweather lives up to his 'Money' nickname by 'tipping every chef at Las Vegas restaurant £235'
text:
Floyd 'Money' Mayweather lived up to his nickname by reportedly tipping every chef £235 after enjoying dinner with friends in Las Vegas this past week.

The 42-year-old had been celebrating a friend's birthday at popular restaurant Catch with 16 others when he decided to visit the kitchen and show the staff just how much he had enjoyed his experience.

An insider told Page Six: 'He personally thanked everyone. The cooks were ecstatic and thankful!'

Floyd Mayweather reportedly tipped every chef £235 after enjoying dinner in Las Vegas

The retired boxer was dining at Catch restaurant with 16 others for a friend's birthday

Catch, an exclusive seafood and steak restaurant that also has venues in Los Anglees and New York, has become a big celebrity hot-spot.

Mayweather has plenty of history of being generous with his wealth, the American having totalled fight earnings in the region of £1billion during his boxing career.

Having finished his trip to Sin City, the former five-weight world champion took to Instagram to share a video of himself boarding his personal private jet on Monday night.

Mayweather has been living the high life since making a victorious one-fight comeback against Conor McGregor in 2017, a bout which took his professional record to 50-0.

Recently he enjoyed a trip to Mexico, where he was seen enjoying some fun in the some in both Cancun and Tulum.
description: Floyd 'Money' Mayweather lived up to his nickname by reportedly tipping every chef £235 after enjoying dinner with friends in Las Vegas this past week.
